title: Introduction to easylift package
code: library("easylift") library("GenomicRanges") #> Loading required package: stats4 #> Loading required package: BiocGenerics #>  #> Attaching package: 'BiocGenerics' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     IQR, mad, sd, var, xtabs #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     anyDuplicated, aperm, append, as.data.frame, basename, cbind, #>     colnames, dirname, do.call, duplicated, eval, evalq, Filter, Find, #>     get, grep, grepl, intersect, is.unsorted, lapply, Map, mapply, #>     match, mget, order, paste, pmax, pmax.int, pmin, pmin.int, #>     Position, rank, rbind, Reduce, rownames, sapply, setdiff, sort, #>     table, tapply, union, unique, unsplit, which.max, which.min #> Loading required package: S4Vectors #>  #> Attaching package: 'S4Vectors' #> The following object is masked from 'package:utils': #>  #>     findMatches #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     expand.grid, I, unname #> Loading required package: IRanges #> Loading required package: GenomeInfoDb

title: Introduction to easylift package
text: Create GRanges object, assign genome , specify chain file
code: gr <- GRanges(seqname = Rle(paste("chr", 1, sep = "")),               ranges = IRanges(start = 1, end = 200000)) genome(gr) <- "hg19" to <- "hg38"  # you should next just point directly to a file on your machine. # here, we use the `system.file()` function because this is a vignette chain <- system.file("extdata/hg19ToHg38.over.chain.gz", package="easylift")  gr #> GRanges object with 1 range and 0 metadata columns: #>       seqnames    ranges strand #>          <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> #>   [1]     chr1  1-200000      * #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from hg19 genome; no seqlengths

title: Introduction to easylift package
code: easylift(gr, to, chain) #> GRanges object with 2 ranges and 0 metadata columns: #>       seqnames        ranges strand #>          <Rle>     <IRanges>  <Rle> #>   [1]     chr1  10001-177376      * #>   [2]    chr19 242824-242864      * #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 25 sequences (1 circular) from hg38 genome

title: Introduction to easylift package
text: chain file cache BiocFileCache package, don’t specify chain argument

what: An R package to perform genomic liftover
title: An R package to perform genomic liftover
text: goal easylift perform genomic liftover given GRanges chain file.

title: An R package to perform genomic liftover
An R package to perform genomic liftover
text: Import libraries Call easylift GRanges object, target genome chain file.
code: library("easylift") library("GenomicRanges") gr <- GRanges(seqname = Rle(paste("chr", 1, sep = "")),               ranges = IRanges(start = 1, end = 200000)) genome(gr) <- "hg19" to <- "hg38" chain <- "hg19ToHg38.over.chain.gz"  easylift(gr, to, chain)

what: Lift genomic coordinates from one genome assembly to another. — easylift
title: Lift genomic coordinates from one genome assembly to another. — easylift
text: function takes GRanges object genomic coordinates one genome assembly lifts another genome assembly using chain file.

title: Lift genomic coordinates from one genome assembly to another. — easylift
Lift genomic coordinates from one genome assembly to another. — easylift
text: x GRanges object genomic coordinates original assembly. target genome assembly (e.g., "hg38"). chain path chain file containing liftover mapping. Can provided gzipped non-gzipped format.

title: Lift genomic coordinates from one genome assembly to another. — easylift
